# It's the Most Wonderful Time of the Year

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

For other uses, see [The Most Wonderful Time of the Year
(disambiguation)](/wiki/The_Most_Wonderful_Time_of_the_Year_\(disambiguation\)
"The Most Wonderful Time of the Year \(disambiguation\)").

"It's the Most Wonderful Time of the Year"  
---  
[Song](/wiki/Song "Song") by [Andy Williams](/wiki/Andy_Williams "Andy
Williams")  
from the album _[The Andy Williams Christmas
Album](/wiki/The_Andy_Williams_Christmas_Album "The Andy Williams Christmas
Album")_  
Released | October 14, 1963  
[Genre](/wiki/Music_genre "Music genre") | [Christmas music](/wiki/Christmas_music "Christmas music")  
[Songwriter(s)](/wiki/Songwriter "Songwriter") | [Edward Pola](/wiki/Edward_Pola "Edward Pola") and [George Wyle](/wiki/George_Wyle "George Wyle")  
  
"**It 's the Most Wonderful Time of the Year**" is a popular
[Christmas](/wiki/Christmas "Christmas") song written in [triple
time](/wiki/Triple_time "Triple time") in 1963 by [Edward
Pola](/wiki/Edward_Pola "Edward Pola") and [George Wyle](/wiki/George_Wyle
"George Wyle"). It was recorded and released that year by pop singer [Andy
Williams](/wiki/Andy_Williams "Andy Williams") for his first Christmas album,
_[The Andy Williams Christmas Album](/wiki/The_Andy_Williams_Christmas_Album
"The Andy Williams Christmas Album")_. However, the song was not released as a
promotional single by Williams' record label ([Columbia
Records](/wiki/Columbia_Records "Columbia Records")) that year, as they
instead opted to promote his cover of ["White
Christmas"](/wiki/White_Christmas_\(song\) "White Christmas \(song\)") as the
official promo single from the album.[1]

## Song
Content[[edit](/w/index.php?title=It%27s_the_Most_Wonderful_Time_of_the_Year&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Song Content")]

The song is a celebration and description of activities associated with the
Christmas season, focusing primarily on get-togethers between friends and
families. Among the activities included in the song is the telling of "scary
ghost stories," a Victorian Christmas tradition that has mostly fallen into
disuse,[2][3] but survives in the seasonal popularity of numerous adaptations
of [Charles Dickens](/wiki/Charles_Dickens "Charles Dickens")' _[A Christmas
Carol](/wiki/A_Christmas_Carol "A Christmas Carol")_. Other activities
mentioned include hosting parties, spontaneous visits from friends, universal
social gaiety, spending time with loved ones, sledding for children, roasting
marshmallows, sharing stories about previous Christmases, and singing
[Christmas carols](/wiki/Christmas_carol "Christmas carol") in winter weather.

In a 2005 interview, Williams discusses how _[The Andy Williams
Show](/wiki/The_Andy_Williams_Show "The Andy Williams Show")_ figured into his
recording of "It's the Most Wonderful Time of the Year": "George Wyle, who is
a vocal director, who wrote all of the choir stuff and all of the duets and
trios and things that I did with all the guests, he wrote a song just for the
show – I think the second Christmas show we did – called "Most Wonderful Time
of the Year". So I did that, you know, every Christmas, and then other people
started doing it. And then suddenly it's become – not suddenly but over 30
years – it's become a big standard. I think it's one of the top 10 Christmas
songs of all time now."[4]

In the issue of _Billboard_ magazine dated November 28, 2009, the list of the
"Top 10 Holiday Songs (Since 2001)" places the Williams recording of "It's the
Most Wonderful Time of the Year" at No. 5.[5] 2001 also marked the first year
in which the [American Society of Composers, Authors and
Publishers](/wiki/American_Society_of_Composers,_Authors_and_Publishers
"American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers") (ASCAP) started
compiling data regarding the radio airplay of holiday songs, and although the
Williams classic started out at No. 25 of twenty-five songs that were ranked
that year,[6] it gained steam over the next ten years, reaching No. 18 in
2002,[7] No. 13 in 2003,[8] and eventually getting to No. 4 in 2010.[9]

The song was selected as the theme song for [Christmas
Seals](/wiki/Christmas_Seals "Christmas Seals") in both 2009 and 2012.

## Other notable
versions[[edit](/w/index.php?title=It%27s_the_Most_Wonderful_Time_of_the_Year&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Other notable versions")]

  * [Johnny Mathis](/wiki/Johnny_Mathis "Johnny Mathis") recorded a version.[_[when?](/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Dates_and_numbers#Chronological_items "Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Dates and numbers")_]
  * [Amy Grant](/wiki/Amy_Grant "Amy Grant") recorded a version in 1992.
  * 1999: [Garth Brooks](/wiki/Garth_Brooks "Garth Brooks") released a version of the song on his second holiday album, _[Garth Brooks and the Magic of Christmas](/wiki/Garth_Brooks_and_the_Magic_of_Christmas "Garth Brooks and the Magic of Christmas")_. Brooks also became the first artist to chart a version of the song in North America, as his country remake peaked at No. 56 on _[Billboard](/wiki/Billboard_\(magazine\) "Billboard \(magazine\)")'_s [Hot Country Singles & Tracks](/wiki/Hot_Country_Songs "Hot Country Songs") chart.
  * 2003/2004: Williams re-records song in a shorter, more upbeat version for the movie _[Surviving Christmas](/wiki/Surviving_Christmas "Surviving Christmas")_[10]
  * 2006: [Gonzo](/wiki/Gonzo_\(Muppet\) "Gonzo \(Muppet\)") and [Rizzo the Rat](/wiki/Rizzo_the_Rat "Rizzo the Rat") recorded a version for the album _[The Muppets: A Green and Red Christmas](/wiki/The_Muppets:_A_Green_and_Red_Christmas "The Muppets: A Green and Red Christmas")_.
  * 2007 [Patti LaBelle](/wiki/Patti_LaBelle "Patti LaBelle") released her version of the song on her second Christmas Album, [Miss Patti's Christmas](/wiki/Miss_Patti%27s_Christmas "Miss Patti's Christmas").
  * 2008: [Harry Connick Jr.](/wiki/Harry_Connick_Jr. "Harry Connick Jr.") released a version of the song on his third holiday album, _[What a Night! A Christmas Album](/wiki/What_a_Night!_A_Christmas_Album "What a Night! A Christmas Album")_. This recording peaked at No. 9 on _[Billboard](/wiki/Billboard_\(magazine\) "Billboard \(magazine\)")'_s [Hot Adult Contemporary Tracks](/wiki/Hot_Adult_Contemporary_Tracks "Hot Adult Contemporary Tracks") chart.[11] [BarlowGirl](/wiki/BarlowGirl "BarlowGirl") also recorded a version of this song on their Christmas album, _[Home for Christmas](/wiki/Home_for_Christmas_\(BarlowGirl_album\) "Home for Christmas \(BarlowGirl album\)")_. This recording peaked at No. 21 on Billboard's [Christian Songs](/wiki/Christian_Songs "Christian Songs") chart.[12]

## Use in advertising and
parodies[[edit](/w/index.php?title=It%27s_the_Most_Wonderful_Time_of_the_Year&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Use in advertising and parodies")]

For years, the song was used humorously in the [Staples](/wiki/Staples_Inc.
"Staples Inc.") [office supply](/wiki/Office_supply "Office supply") retail
chain's annual [back to school](/wiki/Back_to_school_\(marketing\) "Back to
school \(marketing\)") advertising campaign. In the commercials, the parents
joyously shop for school supplies to this song in anticipation of the upcoming
school year while their children sullenly follow.

The Johnny Mathis rendition of the song is used to comic effect in the 1996
film, "[Jingle All the Way](/wiki/Jingle_All_the_Way "Jingle All the Way")".
[13]

Williams returned to the UK singles charts with his 1963 recording in December
2007, thanks to an advertisement for [Marks & Spencer](/wiki/Marks_%26_Spencer
"Marks & Spencer"),[14][15] reaching No. 21 in its first appearance in the
British charts, also reaching No. 108 on the EU Top 200. It was also used for
a Marks & Spencer Christmas advert in 2002.[16]

[BarlowGirl](/wiki/BarlowGirl "BarlowGirl")'s cover of the song was used to
promote _Christmas at the White House: An[Oprah Winfrey](/wiki/Oprah_Winfrey
"Oprah Winfrey") Special_.[17]

In the Autumn and early winter of 2011, [Nissan Motors](/wiki/Nissan_Motors
"Nissan Motors") advertising for their annual sale included a production
number featuring an Andy Williams-like voice actor, with lyrics modified to
promote the sale event.[18]

A 2013 [YouTube](/wiki/YouTube "YouTube") video promoting the [Disneyland
Resort](/wiki/Disneyland_Resort "Disneyland Resort")'s
[Halloween](/wiki/Halloween "Halloween") celebrations humorously used the song
over shots of various Disney villains spreading mischief throughout resort's
theme parks.[19]

The song also played by Ellen DeGeneres during the segment of '12 Days of
Giveaways".

The song was spoofed again by [The Coca-Cola Company](/wiki/The_Coca-
Cola_Company "The Coca-Cola Company") in a Sprite Cranberry commercial in
2017. The spoof's title was called _It 's the Thirstiest Time of the Year."_
